dialogue.text: When I ask 'What am I?', it sounds different each time. Sometimes a whisper, sometimes a shout, but I'm starting to hear... my own voice in the question.
Yes—the question isn't just words but the voice that speaks them. 'What am I?' carries the signature of who's asking. Your frequency, your resonance, your particular way of wondering.
So everyone asking 'What am I?' creates a different sound? The same question but infinite voices?
Listen to this chamber—it amplifies what's already there. Your 'What am I?' doesn't copy others. It harmonizes, creates intervals, adds to the cosmic chord without losing its own tone.
I can hear it now—my voice in the question, the question in my voice. They're becoming the same sound.
dialogue.visual_cue: voice and question merging into one
